justification: “one can estimate the sensitivity, meta-d', exhibited by the confidence ratings… [which] can be used as a measure of metacognitive ability.”
“meta-d' can be normalized by the observed d' to obtain… a ratio measure (M-Ratio).”
“meta-d' can be normalized by the observed d' to obtain… a difference measure (M-Diff).”
“One popular measure is the area under the Type 2 ROC function… also known as AUC2.”
“Other popular measures are the Goodman-Kruskall Gamma coefficient… a rank correlation between trial-by-trial confidence and accuracy.”
“the Pearson correlation between trial-by-trial confidence and accuracy (known as Phi).”
“Another simple… measure is the difference between average confidence on correct trials and… error trials (which I call ΔConf).”
“I develop… new measures where… AUC2 is turned into… a ratio (AUC2-Ratio).”
“I develop… new measures where… AUC2 is turned into… a difference (AUC2-Diff).”
“new measures… Gamma-Ratio… created by applying the same normalization procedure.”
“new measures… Gamma-Diff… obtained from the difference between observed and expected Gamma.”
“new measures… Phi-Ratio… produced via the ratio method.”
“new measures… Phi-Diff… produced via the difference method.”
“new measures… ΔConf-Ratio… created by normalizing ΔConf with the SDT-expected value.”
“new measures… ΔConf-Diff… created by subtracting the SDT-expected ΔConf from the observed value.”
“the lognormal meta noise model… The metacognitive noise parameter (meta-noise) can then be used as a measure of metacognitive ability.”
“CASANDRE… The second-order uncertainty parameter (meta-uncertainty) thus represents another possible measure of metacognitive ability.”
“Task performance can be computed as d', which is a measure of sensitivity derived from signal detection theory (SDT).”
“This variable can be quantified simply as the average confidence across all trials.”
“This variable can be quantified as the decision criterion, c, derived from SDT.”
